page.title: 14Equestrian Activities.
page.content: The role of the horse has changed completly since the arrival of motor veicles. In a rural place such as Blakesley the horse played a major part both on the farm and as a method of transport.Nowadays horses are kept mainly for pleasure.Blakesley is the heart land of the Grafton Hunt and each season the Opening Meet is held on the village green,usually on the first Tuesday in November.It is a splendid sight, horses and riders vying with each other to see who can be the smartest.As well as hunters exercising through the village, and the ordinary much loved children's ponies, there are some very successful show horses,ponies and show jumpers all living and working in and around the village.Many horses from the village compete successfully in the local show,which is to a very high standard.
